h3. Problem Definition
The New User Onboarding feature is currently a one-off feature and cannot be reset. More information about this can be found in the following KB:

[How the User Onboarding process works?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=792311785]

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Administrators to reset New User Onboarding feature

fields.description:
Unable to select all options in Issue Navigator screen
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59412].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When using the drop-down menus in the issue navigator screen, users receive the following prompt: 'X more options. Continue typing to refine further.' This shows up in multiple search fields and can prevent users from finding the option they are looking for if they are unsure of the exact name of that value. It can also cause some values to become un-selectable.

For example, when using List View of Issue Navigator, the user has the ability to select fields to add as Columns to the list. The Columns drop down selector can only display 25 fields at any time. In order to see more, the user is prompted with a message as follows: _+## more options. Continue typing to refine further.+_
 In the circumstance where a user is trying to search for a value (e.g. "*Type*"), but the environment has *more* than 25 fields (including Custom Fields) which have the word "Type" as part of the value, the user may not be able to find "*Type*" in the list, yet, they cannot refine further by adding more characters; they are only looking for "*Type*".

This impacts users with a large number of custom fields in their environment, who might stumble into this issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

In any other field, the search needs to be refined further to select certain values. This is not the cause for other fields, like the inline user picker in the issue view which displays all options. There are two existing feature requests for this issue:
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39700
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44667

The value not being selectable can be reproduced in the list view:
 # Create one custom field with a specific name (e.g. "Type")
 # Create at least 25 other custom fields with any combination of characters, *followed by* "Type" (e.g. "Example Type")
 # Go to the Issue Navigator, and be in List View.
 # Click the Columns dropdown, and search for "Type"

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to select "Type". This could be accomplished by allowing the user to expand the search results without typing (e.g. +_Click to refine further_+)
h3. Actual Results

The user is prompted to continue typing to refine further. Any further typing beyond "*Type*" will result in a non-match for the value "*Type*", making it impossible to select this value.
h3. Workaround 1
 # Rename the custom field to something else which does not cause this issue in the Column search.
 # Add this renamed field as a column to the List View in the Issue Navigator
 # Rename the custom field back to what it originally was

h3. Workaround 2

Increase the number of fields displayed in the control from the default 25.

Note, that this only helps if the number of status-named fields is not significantly higher than 25, where increasing the threshold will allow you to easily filter through all status-named fields without cutting off.
 # Modify the file {{<JIRA_INSTALL_DIR>/atlassian-jira/includes/ajs/list/List.js}} as below (after backing up the original file)
 find the line below:
{code:javascript}
var maxResult = this.maxInlineResultsDisplayed;{code}
and modify it as below, for example:
{code:javascript}
var maxResult = 40;{code}
Here 40 is the new max length of the list, instead of 25. If this is not enough you may increase it further, but too large values can cause other issues related to display, so better to keep this as low as possible.
 # Rename List-min.js file to List-min.js.hide.
 # Restart Jira, clear the browser cache, and test if you can reach the desired field.

(i) Note that if you update Jira, this procedure will have to be applied again on each node.
h3. Workaround 3

Select the required field via developer tools manipulations in the browser. You can manually locate the required input control for the field from the page source code, and enable it by following these steps. In this case, we will do this with the "Status" field:
 # Perform an issue query or click "View all issues and filters" to cause a list of issues to be displayed.
 # Click on the "Columns" dropdown.
 # Scroll to the bottom of the list.
 # Right-click on the text "Continue typing to refine further". (You can actually right-click anywhere in the Columns chooser, but this puts you close to the tag you're going to be looking for in step 6.)
 # Select "Inspect" (on Chrome). This should open a browser development window to the right where you can inspect and modify the page's HTML.
 # In the "Elements" window at the top of the inspection area (on Chrome), scroll down until you see an element titled
 {{<select id="user-column-sparkler"...>.}}
 # Expand "user-column-sparkler".
 # Expand "optgroup label" within it.
 # Scroll down until you find the node <option title="Status" value="status">Status</option> (It may be necessary to click "Show all nodes" to see it.)
 # Right-click on that node and select "Add attribute". Type: selected="selected". The node should now read:
 <option title="Status" value="status" selected="selected">Status</option>
 # Click "Done" back in the column chooser widget.
 # The "Status" column should now appear in your issues list. It should not be necessary to repeat this.
fields.summary: See more available fields for Columns in Issue Navigator without typing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59409].
  {panel}

Many of the pages at developer.atlassian.com have links that just redirect to themselves or to pages that no longer exist. I strongly advise Atlassian to make documentation a higher priority. 

Example page:
https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/jira-templates-and-jsps/creating-a-custom-release-notes-template-containing-release-comments#

Every link in that article redirects to the same page.

Write a script to crawl your docs and then fix broken links, update old information, or remove out of date info.
fields.summary: Dead links everywhere

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59405].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA Tomcat Access Logging doesn't log Java thread name.
{code:java}
127.0.0.1 747x53x5 admin [15/Jan/2016:12:27:39 +0100] "GET /rest/api/1.0/shortcuts/64027/7dc8e5bd8fc0e785f91b1532614125de/shortcuts.js HTTP/1.1" 200 522 10 "http://127.0.0.1:8080/secure/admin/ViewLogging.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:43.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/43.0" "1fq3aby"
{code}
This makes troubleshooting of performance problems more complicated, as it hard to get thread from URL and other way around.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add Java thread name "%I" to {{server.xml}}:
{code:java}
pattern="%a %{jira.request.id}r %{jira.request.username}r %t "%m %U%q %H" %s %b %D "%{Referer}i" "%{User-Agent}i" "%{jira.request.assession.id}r" %I"
{code}
h3. Workaround

Manually modify {{server.xml}}: :
{code:java}
--- atlassian-jira-6.4.12-standalone/conf/server.xml.orig	2016-01-15 12:49:50.000000000 +0100
+++ atlassian-jira-6.4.12-standalone/conf/server.xml	2016-01-15 12:56:37.000000000 +0100
@@ -161,7 +161,7 @@

             -->
             <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve" resolveHosts="false"
-                   pattern="%a %{jira.request.id}r %{jira.request.username}r %t "%m %U%q %H" %s %b %D "%{Referer}i" "%{User-Agent}i" "%{jira.request.assession.id}r""/>
+                   pattern="%a %{jira.request.id}r %{jira.request.username}r %t "%m %U%q %H" %s %b %D "%{Referer}i" "%{User-Agent}i" "%{jira.request.assession.id}r" %I"/>

         </Engine>
     </Service>*
{code}
fields.summary: Add thread name to Tomcat access.log logger

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59404].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA _HTTP Access Logging_ doesn't log Java thread name. 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
127.0.0.1 i741x66x1 admin [15/Jan/2016:12:21:05 +0100] "GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/secure/admin/ViewLogging.jspa HTTP/1.1" - - - "http://127.0.0.1:8080/secure/admin/ViewLogging.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:43.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/43.0" "uus68a" INFO
{code}
This makes troubleshooting of performance problems more complicated, as it hard to get thread from URL and other way around. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add Java thread name to {{log4j.properties}}: 
{code}
log4j.appender.httpaccesslog.layout.ConversionPattern=%m %t%n
{code}
 
h3. Workaround 
Manually modify {{log4j.properties}}: :
{code}
-- atlassian-jira-6.4.12-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties.orig	2015-08-25 04:26:52.000000000 +0200
+++ atlassian-jira-6.4.12-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties	2016-01-15 12:23:31.000000000 +0100
@@ -122,7 +122,7 @@
 log4j.appender.httpaccesslog.MaxFileSize=20480KB
 log4j.appender.httpaccesslog.MaxBackupIndex=5
 log4j.appender.httpaccesslog.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
-log4j.appender.httpaccesslog.layout.ConversionPattern=%m%n
+log4j.appender.httpaccesslog.layout.ConversionPattern=%m %t%n

 log4j.appender.httpdumplog=com.atlassian.jira.logging.JiraHomeAppender
 log4j.appender.httpdumplog.File=atlassian-jira-http-dump.log
{code}
fields.summary: Add thread name to httpaccesslog log4j logger
Resolving an issue as "Duplicate" should require a Ticket-ID

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59402].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Before JIRA 7, JIRA was shipped with JSP files where customization in [JIRA templates and JSPs|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/jira-templates-and-jsps] is possible. In JIRA 7, it's all compiled and there is no JSP files shipped together with the installer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship JSP files like how it does in JIRA 6 and etc.

h3. Note
* JIRA 6.4.x, the path is {{[JIRA Installation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-installation-directory-189891102.html]\work\Catalina\localhost_\org\apache\jsp}}.
* For JIRA 7, the path is {{[JIRA Installation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-installation-directory-189891102.html]\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\jsp}}.
fields.summary: JSP files are missing in JIRA 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59400].
  {panel}


h3. Summary:
Currently, when JIRA process an email in the configured mail handler, it is either create a new ticket in the instance or silently reject the mail with some information written in the logs. Hence, it will be great if there is a notification to the sender if their email is rejected, such as how when an user is not allowed to access a certain page in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Configured JIRA Incoming Mail
# Make sure that the "Create Users" function is disabled
# Send an email to the Incoming Mail Address as an Unregistered User

h3. Current Result:
* JIRA will process it and mark it as read, but the ticket is not created. The information why will be found on the logs.

h3. Desired Result:
* JIRA will process it and mark it as read, but the ticket is not created. There will be a notification to the sender that the email has been rejected.

h3. Note:
* This should apply to JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler as well.
fields.summary: "Your Mail is Rejected" Notification

h3. Summary
Integrity Checker page is not being translated fully based on the user profile language setting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the *Default language* for JIRA *Spanish (Spain)*.
# Set the user profile language to *English (United States)*.
# Restart JIRA.
# Navigate Administration > System > Integrity checker.
# The page will not be translated fully.

h3. Expected Results
All the words are translated to English.

h3. Actual Results
 !integrity_checker.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Certain lines in Integrity Checker page are not being translated

h3. Problem Definition
When Defining component for projects , currently there are only one person that can be the assignee to a component.

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA handles Versions and Components separately as they are independent of each other. They are both specific to a single project, but there is not a process of restricting version after selecting a component. Customer want the Affected Version to be a subset of the Component value.

h3. Suggested Solution
When editing a issue , after user selected a component, the affected versions should be  available for selection where the value are specific for particular selected component.The affected version should be subset of the Component value.
fields.summary: The Affected Version value should be subset of the Component value when editing Issue

h3. Summary
Subtask Icons are not shown in the contextual help in JIRA 7.0.0. 

h3. Environment
This issue can be replicated in JIRA 7.0.0, but not in previous versions such as 6.4 or JIRA 6.3.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue
# Click create sub task
# Click help icon next to Issue Type dropdown
# New window appears. Scroll approx. half way down to section "For Sub Task Issues". Section is blank. 

h3. Expected Results
The Sub Task Icons should be displayed next to the Issue Type name.

h3. Actual Results
A Blank square is displayed as per the screenshot.
 !bug.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Issue Reporter notes:
I have verified the icon images are not present in the specified directory.
Presumably there should also be some description of each sub task issue type.
fields.summary: Missing sub task icons in issue type help page
Ability to render screenshot images sent by e-mail in the description field.

fields.description:
The incorrect locale name "en_UK" in the default JIRA UK language pack causes JIRA to supply an invalid Locale object for itself and for dependent plugins, which results in a wide range of localization failures when users have that language profile selected.

The correct locale string is "en_GB", as [defined by Java itself|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/javase7locales-334809.html]. The language pack provided with JIRA should have its suffix changed to en_GB in order to work properly.

Providing the wrong en_UK locale string causes the following problems:

h3. Issue #1: JIRA provides two "English - United Kingdom" options in language lists

a- If your JVM is configured to start up with the English default locale as follows:

{code}-Duser.country=GB -Duser.language=en{code}

then administrators will see *two* English options when configuring the system default language under Cog->System->General Configuration->Edit Settings:

# English - United Kingdom \[default\]
# English - UK

!admin-two-locales.png|thumbnail! 

The first choice above will provide a legal Locale object for the UK (since it copies the system default locale). The second option results in an invalid Locale object being provided to the user. (If the JVM is not configured for the UK locale, only the invalid "English - UK" locale option will be presented and there will be no opportunity to receive a valid UK Locale object.)

b- If the system administrator has "English - United Kingdom" selected as the system default language as above, then when users go to select a language in their language profile, they too will be able to select either "English - United Kingdom" or "English - UK" as their language. If the user selects "English - UK", the user will receive an invalid Locale.

!user-two-locales.png|thumbnail!

However, if the administrator selects any other default locale in the General Configuration page (such as "English - UK" or "English - US"), or if the JVM is not configured to have the UK as the default locale at all, then users will only see the one *invalid* UK locale ("English - UK") in the language list in their profiles, and they will not ever be able to select a correct UK locale either.

h3. Issue #2: the Locale object returned for the "English - UK" locale is invalid and some Locale methods throw exceptions

If the user has selected the invalid "English - UK" locale, then the Locale object throws exceptions when trying to access some methods.

For example, this call:

{code}
Locale locale = ComponentAccessor.getJiraAuthenticationContext().getLocale();
String country = locale.getISO3Country();
{code}

throws a *MissingResourceException* when the user has the "English - UK" locale selected. The call works correctly (and returns the expected "GBR") when the "English - United Kingdom" locale is selected.


h3. Issue #3: an invalid currency symbol is provided for the "English - UK" locale

If we ask Java to give us the currency symbol for the user's locale:

{code}
DecimalFormat decimalFormat = (DecimalFormat)NumberFormat.getInstance(locale);
String currencySymbols = decimalFormat.getDecimalFormatSymbols().getCurrencySymbol();
{code}

then we get the correct "*£*" symbol if the user selected "English - United Kingdom", but a "*¤*" symbol if the user selects "English - UK".

h3. Issue #4: Calendar objects returned for the "English - UK" locale report wrong week numbers

In the UK, a week is defined as starting on Monday. Additionally, the first week in a year is considered to be the first week which contains at least four days of the year. (Reference: Java Calendar class, and also the defaults in the CalendarData_en_GB class in the JRE). Therefore, in the UK, week #1 of January 2016 begins on Monday 2016-01-04. If the user selects the "English - United Kingdom" locale and requests a calendar object with Calendar.getInstance(locale), then this is what they get.

If the user selects the English - UK locale, the locale tells us that the week begins on Sunday and that the first week must contain only one day of the new year. If the user has the invalid "English - UK" locale selected, Calendar objects tell us that week #1 of January 2016 begins on Sunday 2015-12-27, which is incorrect.
fields.summary: JIRA's UK locale name "en_UK" is invalid and causes various localization failures

h3. Summary
Inline editing Multi Check Box will not render correctly after performing certain actions. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a custom field of type multi checkbox with 4 options (you need at least two options to reproduce the issue)
# Add it to a projects screen
# Create a new issue in the project. Do not specify anything for the above checkbox
# Enter the issue and then click on the Edit button
# Select the first 3 options and update
# Inline Edit the checkbox and unselect the first option
!uncheck.png|thumbnail!
# Hit enter to close and save the inline edit
# Again open the inline edit

h3. Expected Results
It should render correctly

h3. Actual Results
# Should should see the first check box rendered incorrectly
!after.png|thumbnail!

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you perform set postfunction to use update issue field, the description field does not follow the wiki format accordingly

h3. Environment
* 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create an issue and insert this code to the description:
{code}
||Misto zmeny||Zadani||Aktualizace zadani - TPS||Gestor PS stop||Zmena provedena||Kontrola provedena||
|KBI| | |N/A| | |	
|DCS| | |N/A| | |
|CMS| | |N/A| | |
|PCBS| |N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|MKTG1,2| | | |N/A| |
|Obch.prod.| | | |N/A| |
{code}
# edit a sample workflow and go to the create transition
# add Update issue Field postfunction
# insert the same text from step1 into the field Description
# publish draft workflow
# create new issue using the workflow that was modified in previous steps
# take a look at field description after issue creation

h3. Expected Results
The value in the description field should following according to the wiki format which is something like the following (wiki format):
{code}
||Misto zmeny||Zadani||Aktualizace zadani - TPS||Gestor PS stop||Zmena provedena||Kontrola provedena||
|KBI| | |N/A| | |	
|DCS| | |N/A| | |
|CMS| | |N/A| | |
|PCBS| |N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|MKTG1,2| | | |N/A| |
|Obch.prod.| | | |N/A| |
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The table is broken because post function Update Issue Field does not support new lines (table MUST contain new lines otherwise will be corrupted) and corrupted table with one row which you will see something like the following (wiki format):
{code}
||*Misto zmeny*||Zadani||Aktualizace zadani - TPS||Gestor PS stop||Zmena provedena||Kontrola provedena|||*KBI*| | |N/A| | | |*DCS*| | |N/A| | | |*CMS*| | |N/A| | | |*PCBS*| |N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A| |*MKTG1,2*| |N/A| | | | |*Obch.prod.*| |N/A| | | |
{code}
fields.summary: update issue field does not follow wiki format in description field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Datacenter nod - failed to restore the snapshot from another node

h3. Environment
* JIRA Datacenter 6.4.12
* 2 Nodes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start index replication at Node2 from Node1
# Watch the status in logs

h3. Expected Results
Index is replicated and Node2 is operational 
Message in logs: 
{noformat}
2016-01-12 01:35:17,456 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Recovering search indexes - 100% complete...
2016-01-12 01:35:17,483 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index restore complete
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
Index is not replicated and Node2 is not operational 
The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
2016-01-12 01:34:24,945 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] Error re-indexing node changes
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Destination '/apps/opt/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/issues' already exists
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:374)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:382)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy17.withReindexLock(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateAffectedIndexes(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:344)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:291)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.access$000(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService$1.run(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:82)
	(...)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Destination '/apps/opt/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/issues' already exists
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.moveDirectory(FileUtils.java:1739)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.moveDirectoryToDirectory(FileUtils.java:1781)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.replaceIndexes(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:452)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:370)
	... 22 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Index restore also initiated automatically when one of nodes finishes full re-index and asks other nodes to apply new index. 

h3.Workaround
Restart Node so it will pickup latest valid Index snapshot from other nodes
fields.summary: JIRA Datacenter node  failed to restore the snapshot from another node

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59385].
  {panel}

In the *[Restoring a Project from Backup document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/restoring-a-project-from-backup-185729444.html]*, it can be read:

{quote}
You cannot import a project directly from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server — the importer will display errors about version mismatches. If you want to restore a project from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server, follow the steps below:

   # Install a new JIRA Server instance (in addition to the one that you want to import your project into). This will be a temporary instance that is used to store a full JIRA import from JIRA Cloud. Ensure that the version of this temporary instance matches the version of the JIRA instance that you want to import your project into, e.g. JIRA 6.2.
   # Do a full JIRA migration from JIRA Cloud to the temporary JIRA Server instance. See Migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server.
   # Export the entire JIRA Server instance.
   # Import the project into your desired JIRA Server instance, by following the instructions in the Restoring your project section below. 
   # (optional) Delete the temporary JIRA Server instance, once the project has completed 
{quote}

This information is incorrect. It's not possible to import a backup from JIRA Cloud to an old version of JIRA Server, specially the 6.2. It's recommended, and sometimes only possible, to restore a JIRA Cloud backup in the latest JIRA Server version.

It's important to make clear that it's not supported and furthermore not possible to use the Project import tool to import data from newer JIRA versions to older JIRA versions.

Regards,
Teilor
fields.summary: Correct the misleading information about Project Import
Auto populated fix version field when issue is resolved
Create hyperlinks for linked issues when outputting with Excel

fields.description:
Summary
Due dates from email notification are having *-1* day value comparing to the issue view on JIRA
JIRA System Timezone has been configured to +3 (Moscow)
The user's profile timezone has been configured to +4(Samara)
Steps to Reproduce
Configure JIRA System Timezone to +3 Moscow

Configure user's profile timezone to +4 Samara

Make sure the create issue screen of the project has the due date field
Create an issue ( with create issue notification configured )
Check email
Expected Results
Due date will be the same as the JIRA Issue (24/Jul/15)

Actual Results
Due date is one day earlier than the actual due Date on the JIRA Issue ( 23/Jul/15 )

Workaround
For the 1st Server : Configure the server system timezone to +4 , User profile timezone to +4
For the 2nd Server : Configure the server system timezone to -4 , User profile timezone to -4
fields.summary: Error in notifications email field "Due Date"

https://appier.atlassian.net/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?projectOrFilterId=filter-12905&periodName=monthly&daysprevious=365&selectedProjectId=10100&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports%3Aresolutiontime-report&Next=Next

I believe it is important to know the resolve time based on create time.

Thanks.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Latin1_General_CI_AI shown as unsupported database in JIRA's logs:

The message in atlassian-jira.log reads:
{noformat}
    ****************************************************************************************************
    You are using an unsupported mssql collation: Latin1_General_CI_AI. This may cause some functionality to not work.
    Please use SQL_Latin1_General_CI_AI or SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI as the collation instead.
    ****************************************************************************************************
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create *Latin1_General_CI_AI* database in Microsoft SQL Database. 
# Connect JIRA to the database.
# Restarting JIRA shows the error in the logs. 

h3. Expected Results
The logs should not fail on this collation for Microsoft SQL Server.

h3. Actual Results
The collation is reported as unsupported. Latin1_General_CI_AI *is supported*.

h3.Workaround
Ignore the Error in the logs and confirm the supported collation with the [JIRA Instance Health Add-on.|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin/server/overview].
fields.summary: Log messages indicate Latin1_General_CI_AI shown as unsupported database collation for MySQL while health check passes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59371].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

From time to time users notice that issues have been deleted, and would like to be able to see who deleted the issue, and when it was deleted.

This could also be useful for pinpointing which backup could be used to [perform a recovery of a deleted issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Recovering+Single+deleted+issues+from+JIRA+Backups].
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an audit log for Issue Deletion.

Further possible outcome: Allow for deleted issues to be restored.
h3. Workaround

Currently it is possible to search for calls such as "/secure/DeleteIssue" in JIRA and/or Tomcat Access log to identify when and who deleted an issue, *however for Cloud customers*:
 * logs are only kept for 30 days
 * it needs to be done by the Atlassian Support Team
 * sometimes issue id's are used in the delete call, which cannot be linked to an issue key after the issue has been deleted
 * it's not possible to see who made the request
fields.summary: Provide an Audit Log for Deleted Issues in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59368].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-issue-level-security-185729623.html
This page contains this:
bq.  (A security level of 'None' means that anybody can see the issue.)
What does it means 'anybody'.
It's viewable without authentication?
Or it's viewable for all authenticated users?
Or it is viewable for all project members?
I think it's based on several system settings, but I've not found any page in your documentation where it was specified exactly. I think you should define on this page.
fields.summary: On 'Configuring Issue-level Security' page 'anybody' is unspecified for None security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59366].
  {panel}

As a JIRA admin, we are used to receive  requests from users asking to access a project, but we are not able to know if the user really can access the project and which role the user should be applied for.

So, we forward the request to the project lead (also in project administrator role), asking to provide the proper access to the user.

Suggestion.
1 User go to PROJECTS menu and select the desired project
2 JIRA shows a screen saying the user does not have access to the project and there is a button where user can send a notification to the project administrators (role) justifing why the user need to access that project.
3 Project admin receives by email the access request, and add the user to the proper role
4 Project admin can reply the email to the user.
fields.summary: Option for users to request project access directly to project Lead

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Make possible to limit the download size for files generated by JIRA in an issue.
When user use the *download all attachments* option in a JIRA issue it generates a zip file. If this file is too large it will drop the application.

h3. Suggested Solution
Limit the size file for downloading.

h3. Workaround 
Hide that option by disabling zip support in JIRA.
# Go to Administration;
# Attachments:
# Edit Settings;
# Enable ZIP support (OFF).
fields.summary: Limit the download size for the zip file generated on JIRA issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After migrate JIRA from 6.x to 7.0.x, the _Created vs. Resolved_ gadget is not respecting the "Cumulative Totals" option previously set.

In JIRA 6.x, the gadget had the “Cumulative Totals” option where you can set "Yes" or "No", and in JIRA 7.x has a “Collection Operation” with “Count” or “Cumulative” options.
If you set "Yes" for the “Cumulative Totals” option in JIRA 6.x, after migrate you expect to see the _Cumulative_ option there, however the system is changing it to "Count" instead, so you need to manually edit each Dashboard back to the _Cumulative_ option, which can be a pain if you have a quite few Dashboards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new "Created vs. Resolved gadget" in JIRA 6.4.12
# Select a desired project name (e.g TEST) and change *Cumulative Totals:* to *YES* value
# Save the gadget and create a backup out
# Restore the backup to JIRA 7.0.10
# Navigate back to the Dashboard page, you will get the error message below:
{code}
Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.
Invalid field. Valid values are [count, cumulative].
{code}

!created_vs_resolved_gadget.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
If the previously version was configured with _Cumulative Totals = Yes_, it would be great if the new version (7.0.x) could keep the user's choice by setting _Collection Operation = Cumulative_.
Or maybe we can add an option to define the default value from this field in JIRA, so all dashboards can use the default value.

h3. Actual Results

In JIRA 6, it was configured with _Cumulative Totals = Yes_ but in the latest JIRA 7, it shows errors.

 
h3. Workaround 
Ask all users to manually edit their Dashboards in case they are using this gadget.
fields.summary: Created vs. Resolved gadget should respect the Cumulative Totals option set before the upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Java rarely crash (SIGSEGV) in HotSpot with error 'jvm.dll ciObjectFactory::create_new_metadata'

h3. Environment
* Java 8u40+ 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unknown 

h3. Expected Results
Works fine.

h3. Actual Results
JVM crash, in hs_err_pidXX.log  can be found:
{noformat}
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_45-b14) (build 1.8.0_45-b14)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.45-b02 mixed mode linux-amd64 compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# V  [libjvm.so+0x432007]  ciObjectFactory::create_new_metadata(Metadata*)+0x327

---------------  T H R E A D  ---------------
Current thread (0x00007fcded5c2800):  JavaThread "C2 CompilerThread0" daemon [_thread_in_vm, id=27072, stack(0x00007fcd69e46000,0x00007fcd69f47000)]

siginfo: si_signo: 11 (SIGSEGV), si_code: 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), si_addr: 0x0000000000000013
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
See:
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8134389
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8078731

Outside of JIRA, we've observed Confluence running Java 8u40 and 8u66 being affected.

h3.Workaround
For Jira 6.4 - downgrade to Java7

Given this is currently appearing to be a Java bug we're a bit limited in how we can help further. 

h4. Update 2016-02-09 from Oracle [see [JDK-8134389|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8134389]]
Status: IN PROGRESS
Understanding: Cause Known
Missing corner case handling of type 'instance_klass' in method LoadIndexed::declared_type. Similar corner case is taken care in another method “LoadIndexed::exact_type”.

h4. Update 2016-02-12 
* We see that in most cases there is -javaagent configured, but not sure if that 100% is related.
* Feedback from client: 
bq. We upgraded to the New Relic 3.25.0 agent. Our Confluence is still on 5.8.4, and our Java is still 8u60. We got through the 24-hour danger zone without any nodes crashing with a SIGSEGV, so very promising!

h4. Update 2017-05-29 from Oracle [see [JDK-8134389|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8134389]]
Status:RESOLVED
Fix Version/s:  9
Backport to Java 8u152, see https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8168123

h3. Summary
Importing issues using CSV returns error when username contains space

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud version {{7.1.0-OD-04-012}} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with a space in their username (e.g: john doe)
# Select *Import Issues from CSV* from *Issues* blue menu bar.
# Upload *CSV Source File*. Click _Next_.
# Select any project. Click _Next_.
# Map appropriate fields and click _Next_.
# Click _Validate_

h3. Expected Results
No error is retured.

h3. Actual Results
Error is returned:
{noformat}
The validation process has found 1 error/s:

Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ The reporter specified is not a user. ]
{noformat}

or
{noformat}
The validation process has found 1 error/s:

Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ User 'johndoe' does not exist. ]
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Trying to escape the space with {{' '}} or {{" "}} or {{/ /}} doesn't work as well.

* The documentation on *Importing Issues* also does not specify whether this is allowed or not:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html

h3.Workaround
* Remove the space in the username
fields.summary: Importing issues using CSV returns error when username contains space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Migrating users from Delegated LDAP Authentication directory to internal directory is not working. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a clean instance of JIRA 6.4.8, add a user directory using "Internal with LDAP authentication"
# Use "Copy User on Logon" checkbox
# Login with some AD users so that there are some users in the Delegated LDAP directory.
# Now, logging in as the Internal Directory LDAP user, try to migrate users from  "Internal with LDAP authentication" directory to Internal directory.
# The message comes up : "0 of 2 users successfully migrated."
# None of the users are migrated and there is nothing in the logs

h3. Expected Results
All users from the delegated directory should get migrated to the Internal directory


h3. Actual Results
The users do not get migrated
There are no errors shown up in the logs.
 

h3. Workaround
(i) Before proceeding with the workaround, please make a backup of your database so that it is possible to roll back to the original state in case something goes wrong.

# Run this query in the database :
{code}update cwd_user set external_id = '' where directory_id = <id of the delegated directory you want to migrate>{code}
Note : You can get the directory id by hovering over the User directory on the UI and looking at the url for the link.
# After changing this value, please restart JIRA.
# Now try to run the migration. This time it should run fine.

h3. Alternative way to reproduce the bug

(!) Another way to reproduce this bug is to create users in the Jira internal directory, and then migrate them to an "Internal with LDAP authentication" directory. When doing that, all the users migrated to the "Internal with LDAP authentication" directory will be automatically given a value in the external_id column. Because of that, such users can't be migrated back to the Jira internal directory, unless this column is cleared for them.
fields.summary: Migrating users from Delegated LDAP Authentication directory to internal directory is not migrating users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59330].
  {panel}

*Context:*
The issue creation via the "+ Create issue" (see screenshot) automatically sets Component, FixVersion whenever the board filter mentions one (and only one).
A problem turns up when using one-word components. Differently from muliple-word components, these are NOT added to the create dialog. The absence of double quotes to wrap the Component name appears to trigger this problem.

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Create a board that uses a filter like this one: _Project  = [any one project] and Component = [any one single-word component defined on the project]_
* Go on the Backlog view and hit the button "+Create issue" and then the button "..." (open create dialog)

*Expected behaviour:*
The component field is pre-filled with [any one single-word component defined on the project]

*Actual behaviour:*
The component field is empty

*Notice that*
If the board filter mentions a muliple-word components (insetad of a single-word), the entire flow works fine
fields.summary: Inline issue creation doesn't add one-word Components even when board filter specifies one

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7.0.8, headers dialogs within JIRA overlap large dialog boxes.

h3. Environment
Customers using JIRA 7.0.8 will be affected by this issue and see the broken UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Accessing JIRA and using large dialogs/modal in JIRA such as Create Issue, Log Work will demonstrate this behaviour as per the screenshot below.

h3. Expected Results
The Modals / dialogs should be displayed without overlapping. 

h3. Actual Results

Dialogs in the User Interface appear broken as per the attached screenshot. 
 !Screen Shot 2016-01-12 at 3.18.54 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes 
JIRA 7.0.8 has been removed from the available downloads, and is not recognised as a released version on [https://marketplace.atlassian.com] due to this bug. 

h3. Workaround
If you have upgraded to JIRA 7.0.8, you can either Roll back your Instance to a previous version as per: [Roll back a JIRA application upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/rolling-back-a-jira-application-upgrade-749382718.html] otherwise Downgrade your JIRA instance using the steps below:

# Make a full backup of your environment as in: [Backing up data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Backing+up+data]
# Ensure JIRA 7.0.8 instance is shutdown.
# Install JIRA 7.0.5 into this environment, but not into the same JIRA Install as your 7.0.8 as this will not work.
# Shutdown the JIRA 7.0.5 instance once it has started.  
# Any customisations and data that you have in your JIRA 7.0.8 environment should be migrated to ensure that your JIRA 7.0.5 has these configurations. 
## Copy over any configuration changes that you have made as per our [Upgrading JIRA applications with a fallback method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+with+a+fallback+method]. 
## Copy over Avatars and attachments to your new instance as in [Upgrading JIRA applications with a fallback method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+with+a+fallback+method].
## Migrate any installed-plugins that you would like to install into this JIRA 7.0.5 environment. Note: do not migrate the plugins from your 7.0.8 environment, as this will contain 7.0.8 Add-ons that you should not include.
# Set the flag {{-Djira.downgrade.allowed=true}} as per: [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup]
# Start JIRA 7.0.5
# When asked for connection information to the database, point to the 7.0.8 JIRA database (if you did not copy the {{dbconfig.xml}} file when copying configuration files.)
# The instance should now start and downgrade the JIRA database data. The JIRA version should be reported as 7.0.5.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding this issue or the workaround provided, please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: The Header overlaps over the dialog boxes

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59326].
  {panel}

Hi there
given the level of rights you can manipulate with PARTICIPANT functionality (adding to Permission or issue schemes), it would seem really sensible to have "Modify Participant" as a stand alone permission area, just as you currently have "Modify Reporter"

Customers with several login accounts could then add a participant by choice where we do not allow them to EDIT the full issue (only transition and comments) in the service desk. At this time we would need to manage this for them which creates an necessary overhead for our analysts. In addition this would also help work with enterprise customers who expect to have several individual accounts able to operate easily "together"

This seems to be a real gap in this design to the use of this collaboration tool - it could be doing more for us!!
fields.summary: Create a permission layer of "Modify Participant" as we have for "Modify Reporter"

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
When a user create a new Service Desk issue from the portal, if they break line using //, subsequent formating after this line break are ignored and rather inherit the format set on the line with the break line.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue in Service Desk Customer Portal.
# In the description field, add the following
{noformat}h2. Test \\ h5. Test Again \\ Yet more test, wonder why they run so much test.{noformat}
# Create the issue.

*Expected Behavior*
Issue is created and respects all of the JIRA styling.

*Actual Behavior*
JIRA ignores all styling other than line breaks after the first appearance of //, this makes all lines in the description appear in header 2 format.
fields.summary: Service Desk Does not fully respect Text Formating

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59321].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes Projects in JIRA do not use Bamboo for Release Management, but others do use Bamboo for this purpose. Also, users of those Projects may not have all of the necessary permissions, or it is not desired for those users to use Bamboo or Releasing Versions. However, this is not currently possible. The connection to Bamboo is a global addition to a JIRA environment. Some users would like to configure Bamboo on a Project by Project basis.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Configure Bamboo for only desired Projects when releasing a version.
fields.summary: Remove Bamboo from certain JIRA Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59319].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition

Cannot use the custom field *Select List (multiple choices)* as a means of entering emails and assigning to [Group Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html] in a notification schemes. Email alerts will not works. There is no a way to restrict the values entered in the Select list to just email addresses.

The only two custom fields allowed for Group Custom Field values are: Group Picker or Multi Group Picker. There is an [exception|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12865] when you can use the Select List and Muti Select list in Group Custom Field values is when custom fields store are exact users or group names.

There is not a way for end user to set up an email list using Select List and get the Group Custom Field value to properly send out notifications.

h3. Suggested Solution

Either create a new Group Custom field to allow only email addresses or add functionality to the Select List (multi choice) to be able to be used with the group Custom field notification configuration. 
 
h3. Workaround 

No real workaround. Cannot add text email address as a way be triggered by the notification schemes. End user will need to add the email address as JIRA user.
fields.summary: Allow Select List email values to work with Group Custom Field in Notification Schemes

fields.summary: I can not access to issue Statuses in  "ISSUE ATTRIBUTES"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59304].
  {panel}

All fields that support user mentions are called "mentionable" fields.

Mentionable fields are initialised at one of two times:

* When DomContentLoaded occurs, or
* When the field is focussed by the end-user

This means that some mentionable fields have a chance to not get initialised if:

* The field did not exist in the DOM at the time DomContentLoaded occurred, and
* If the field is programmatically focussed, as opposed to focussed by the end-user.

This happens to be exactly what the "add comment" field does.
fields.summary: Mentions only initialise when the user focuses the field
Race condition in entity engine connection handling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59302].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA 7 allows for the feature flag: {{jira.downgrade.allowed=true}} to be enabled which will give JIRA Admins the option to downgrade JIRA. 

This feature is useful when a migration must occur for technical or operational reasons to an older version. 

The feature is not documented and should be be included in some of the following documentation's perhaps as an include. 

- [Upgrading JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications]
- [Migrating from JIRA Cloud to Server applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Migrating+from+JIRA+Cloud+to+Server+applications]
- [Rolling back a JIRA application upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Rolling+back+a+JIRA+application+upgrade]

h3. Environment
JIRA 7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This is a request to document a new product feature. 

h3. Expected Results
The possibility to downgrade a JIRA version should be made publicly available in the documentation. 

The limitations of this feature such as how far back the instance can be downgraded to should be indicated along with providing some sample usage scenarios.

h3. Actual Results
The flag: "jira.downgrade.allowed=true" and searching for relevant procedures does not return  meaningful results.
fields.summary: Document the downgrade Start up option for JIRA

The same behaviour occurs with an upgrade as well.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.7

Database Product Name is MySQL
Database Product Version is 5.6.22

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install JIRA 7.0.7 using a MySQL Server Database, follow the Wizard steps (up to setting up Mail ?Notifications) where the instance will fail)

Restarting the instance initially looks promising, but then continues to fail when accessing Administrative or User Management areas of the JIRA instance.

h3. Expected Results
When Accessing JIRA for the first time, the instance should show the System Dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
A 500 Error is displayed reporting a SQL Exception 

h3. Workaround
After experiencing the error, restart the JIRA instance. 

- Install JIRA 7.0.5 Instead of JIRA 7.0.7 at this time, 
- Avoid using MySQL with JIRA 7.0.7.

If you have upgraded to JIRA 7.0.7, you can:
-  Roll back your Instance to a previous version as per: [Roll back a JIRA application upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/rolling-back-a-jira-application-upgrade-749382718.html]
- Upgrade to a newer version of JIRA. 
- Downgrade your JIRA instance. 

Downgrade your JIRA instance using the steps below:
# Make a full backup of your environment as in: [Backing up data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Backing+up+data]
# Ensure JIRA 7.0.7 instance is shutdown.
# Install JIRA 7.0.5 into this environment, but not into the same JIRA Install as your 7.0.7 as this will not work.
# Shutdown the JIRA 7.0.5 instance once it has started.  
# Any customisations and data that you have in your JIRA 7.0.7 environment should be migrated to ensure that your JIRA 7.0.5 has these configurations. 
## Copy over any configuration changes that you have made as per our [Upgrading JIRA applications with a fallback method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+with+a+fallback+method]. 
## Copy over Avatars and attachments to your new instance as in [Upgrading JIRA applications with a fallback method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+with+a+fallback+method].
## Migrate any installed-plugins that you would like to install into this JIRA 7.0.5 environment. Note: do not migrate the plugins from your 7.0.7 environment, as this will contain 7.0.7 Add-ons that you should not include.
# Set the flag {{-Djira.downgrade.allowed=true}} as per: [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup]
# Start JIRA 7.0.5
# When asked for connection information to the database, point to the 7.0.7 JIRA database (if you did not copy the {{dbconfig.xml}} file when copying configuration files.)
# The instance should now start and downgrade the JIRA database data. The JIRA version should be reported as 7.0.5.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding this issue or the workaround provided, please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59295].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian team.

As I let you know in a support ticket (https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JSP/issue/JSP-249425), I've been struggling with a strange problem on the plugin I was developing for Jira.
Sometimes, not always, and not for all plugins, when I uninstall and reinstall a plugin (or reload it via FastDev), plugin usage raises the following exception :

{code}
Caused by: org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.ServiceProxyDestroyedException: service proxy has been destroyed
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor$ServiceLookUpCallback.doWithRetry(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:105)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.support.RetryTemplate.execute(RetryTemplate.java:83)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.lookupService(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:430)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.getTarget(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:415)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy3232.find(Unknown Source)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.ovyka.jira.testplugin.dao.impl.ContextDAOImpl.getContextsForProjectAndIssueType(ContextDAOImpl.java:87)
{code}

At first I thought it was coming from the fact I was using Spring autowiring of beans inside my plugin, but declaring them as component (not shared) didn't change anything.

I have investigated more and finally found the cause (and solution) of the problem.

I ran a very deep debug session, going down into Spring Dynamic Modules, Spring Framework and Jira code. I found something really weird about the bundle context (context class of OSGi bundles, which is what Jira plugin really are) : the bundle being called when the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception was raised was NOT the currently deployed plugin version....

To illustrate this, I put some debug points in Felix (OSGi framework implementation used by Jira) BundleContextImpl class, in the invalidate() method (called when a plugin is uninstalled), and in the constructor (called when the plugin is installed). I also place a breakpoint in Spring Dynamic Modules ServiceDynamicInterceptor class, which is were the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception is raised. At each of these breakpoints, I took a "snapshot" of the bundle context for the bundle being used, and here is what came of it :

During uninstallation of a plugin, in BundleContextImpl.invalidate() method, the bundle context is as follows :
{code}
{org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl@41676} 
 m_logger = {com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixLoggerBridge@38134} 
 m_felix = {org.apache.felix.framework.Felix@38135} "org.apache.felix.framework [0]"
 m_bundle = {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl@41677} "com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin [180]"
 m_valid = false

Note the OSGi id of the bundle com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin : 180

When installing the new version of the bundle, here is what I got in the BundleContextImpl constructor :
 {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl@41793} 
 m_logger = {com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixLoggerBridge@38134} 
 m_felix = {org.apache.felix.framework.Felix@38135} "org.apache.felix.framework [0]"
 m_bundle = {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl@41794} "com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin [181]"
 m_valid = true
{code}

Note the OSGi id of the testplugin plugin is different : 181.

Now if i try to use a feature of my plugin, the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception raising breakpoint is hit, and the associated bundle context is :
{code}
 {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl@41970} 
 m_logger = {com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixLoggerBridge@38134} 
 m_felix = {org.apache.felix.framework.Felix@38135} "org.apache.felix.framework [0]"
 m_bundle = {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl@41985} "com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin [173]"
 m_valid = false
{code}

Note that the OSGi id is 173 (so not the uninstalled one, nore the newly installed one), and the bundle context is marked as invalid (m_valid = false).

What I concluded from this is that Jira was keeping a reference to every version of the plugin, and was calling one of them, wether or not it was the latest one.
Actually, after a little more digging, I found out it was not totally exact.
In fact, Jira DOES keep a reference to all the version of the plugin, but does not call one of them : it calls ALL of them.

When, after reaching the first ServiceProxyDestroyed raising breakpoint I let the application continue its work, the breakpoint was hit once again, with a different bundle context (180 in the example above).

After that, it is not called anymore, but the plugin feature work is done. Adding a breakpoint on the called plugin method that Jira was trying to execute, I found out it was actually called, with a different bundle context (181 in the example above), which is why no exception is raised, and the work is done.

So here is the updated conclusion :
Jira keeps a reference to all versions of a bundle (after multiple install/reinstall), and when the plugin is called, Jira calls all of the bundles, one by one.
* For all the inactive versions, a ServiceProxyDestroyed exception is raised (sometimes also ClassNotFound or NoClassDefFound, for classes that ARE in Jira provided classpath (Jira services references by plugins)).
* For the active version, the plugin does its work, without any exception.
So this exception is not blocking, as it does not prevent the work of the plugin to be done, but may be very dangerous, because if the plugin does not require any OSGi reference, no exception will be raised, and the work may done several times...

Now what was left to do was to know why all bundles were kept by Jira (increasing the amount of memory used, by the way). I climbed back the call stack from the ServiceProxyDestroyed raising point, and found out the source of the call was an IssueEventListener. After a small test, I found out the reason of the problem, and of course its solution.

The reason why Jira keeps a reference to all bundle versions is that, when a plugin adds an EventListener to jira, it has to register it into the EventPublisher :  eventPublisher.register(this);
This is not a process linked to OSGi. It is done "programatically", and none of the OSGi bundle uninstalling processes being aware of this link, the listener is NEVER unregistered from the EventPlublisher, if the developer does not unregister it : it stays in the list of listeners registered in Jira.

That explains why my plugin was called multiple times when I was doing an action triggering an IssueEvent. The EventPublisher was calling all of the registered IssueEventListeners, including the ones registered by removed plugins. And this explains also the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception, because when a bundle version is uninstalled, the ServiceProxy provided by Spring Dynamic Modules are actually destroyed, so all the services injected in the uninstalled plugin now are obsolete and linked to nothing.

The solution to this problem (actually one of the solutions) is very simple, and is given in your tutorial page (https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/guides/other/tutorial-writing-jira-event-listeners-with-the-atlassian-event-library) : Make the listener implement DisposableBean and implement the destroy() method with the line : eventPublisher.unregister(this);

I think you should emphasize the fact that this is very important, because given the number of pages about this ServiceProxyDestroyed exception around the net, I am not the only one to have missed this point :)

Now another solution to this problem would be to avoid asking developers to register their listener into the EventPublisher.

A very efficient way to do this would be to implement the OSGi White Board pattern. When developing a listener, the developer would just have to declare it in the atlassian-plugin.xml (for example, declare it using a <listener class=""/> tag, as it is done for rest endpoints), and Jira would just have to publish it as an OSGi service, with restricted access to Jira core only. Now the EventPublisher, instead of maintaining a list of registered listeners, which as we saw does not work well with the dynamic nature of OSGi bundles, would just ask for all services published under a specific marker interface, for example PluginJiraListener (just an example).
OSGi framework would then give it all services implementing this interface, which are available at the time the call is made by the EventPublisher.

This would require a modification of jira core or Jira plugin management plugin, but would avoid this problem and would be a much nicer way to deal with dynamic plugins.
And isn't it how this is done in Confluence ?

Would you consider doing this modification in Jira system ?
fields.summary: Avoid ServiceProxyDestroyed exceptions - event listener improvement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59291].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the exported data from *Issue Navigator* in JIRA, is not exporting date fields as *date* data type in Excel. According to Bartek Gatz in [JRA-11360|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11360], this is something that is being worked on actively by Atlassian. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement Excel exporting where data is formatted correctly. 

h3. Workaround 
Changing the data format manually in Excel _might_ be of help.
fields.summary: Dates should be formatted as Date data type during Export to Excel
aaa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59285].
  {panel}

There are two minor issues with the integration between [Confluence and the Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/advanced-use-of-the-jira-issue-collector-296092376.html#AdvancedUseoftheJIRAIssueCollector-EmbeddingtheIssueCollector]: 

h5.Collector Position 

This one is related to the position that we will need the collector to be displayed in Confluence. When creating a new Issue Collector, one of the options that you can edit is the *Trigger Style*. However, once you have created and saved it, you will still have the *Edit* option, but, even changing the position for the trigger style, it will not be refreshed in Confluence. Even if you remove and add the new script, the position will be the same than the first time. 

The workaround is to create a new Issue Collector with the new position. 

h5.Collector Location

This one is a bit more aesthetic. When selecting the *Subtle* option for the Trigger Style, it will be displayed in the bottom of the page. However, if you edit this page, the collector will be in the same location of the *Close* or the *Save* button. This will make the user to scroll more in order to search for the options to finish the editing of the page.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Collector Integration with Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59281].
  {panel}

h3. Summarry

When clicking 'Today' in the calendar widget in the project version screen you get 01-JAN-1970. This is obviously wrong.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.

* Go to a project's versions.
* Click on Release Date.
* Click on 'Today' in the widget.
* _BUG_ You will notice the date changes to 01-JAN-1970.

h3. Actual Results.

The widget believes today is the 01-JAN-1970.

h3. Expected Results

Clicking on 'Today' from the widget should select today's date according the user's JIRA TZ.

h3. Workaround

Type in or select today's date manually.
fields.summary: When clicking 'Today' in the calendar widget in the project version screen you get 01-JAN-1970

*Summary*: There is no possibility to create ISSUE TYPE Scheme without associated ISSUE TYPE, BUT there is possibility to associate single issue type and then delete it. It brings us to situation that we don't have any TYPE in SCHEME and it can be reason of some issues like this one. When you try to create issue (and system is picking up project without issue type) you will see following error.

 !image-2016-01-07-20-06-38-177.png|thumbnail! 

 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create Issue Type
 # Create Issue Type Scheme and pick up Issue Type you just created
 # Associate project WITHOUT any issue to this Scheme
 # Delete Issue Type
 # Try to create Issue (from dashboard please... it seems that there is little bit inconsistency because when you create issue from Admin page you will see different dialog... and different problem in this case)
 # Select project with scheme without issue type 

 

*Observed problem:*
 - If you are creating issue from dashboard system fails to display dialog (if last opened project was the one without issue type)
 - Same situation for inline issue creation
 - If you try to create issue from admin page you will see issue types for all projects (picture below).
 !image-2016-01-07-20-10-41-916.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Issue dialog failure - when Issue Type Scheme has NO issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to create JQL searches for issues and using user fields such as "Reporter=" or "Assignee=", JIRA is unable to have inactive users appear as selectable options from the auto complete drop down menu.

This works correctly for active users, however it seems that when users are marked inactive the auto complete cannot list that user as an option.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new users 'testuser1' for example
# Assign that user to one or issues
# Within User management, set that user to be inactive
# Go to the Issue Navigator within JIRA and start a JQL search by typing out  "assignee=test" (without quotes)

h3. Expected Results
When typing this out, we would expect the auto complete drop down menu to list all JIRA users that have the string 'test' in their name, including 'testuser1'


h3. Actual Results
The auto complete drop down menu does not list 'testuser1' as a selectable option 
 
h3. Notes
# This appears to effect both Adavanced and Basic JQL searches.
# If you know the exact username or email address of the user, you can still create functioning JQL queries, the issue here is specifically tied to the fact that JIRA's autocomplete/auto-fill feature does not return any inactive users as selectable options.

h3.Workaround
Temporarily marking all inactive users as active is one way to work-around this, but this isn't typically a desirable work-around both from a security aspect as well as from a user licensing limit aspect.  It may not be feasible to do this.
fields.summary: JQL auto complete values for a user field does not include inactive users

fields.description:
(!) This issue is tracked as [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STP-396], this bug is created for Hercules to pick up the regexp. Please monitor that ticket for progress.
h4. Problem
When generating a support.zip with version 3.7.11 of the [Support Tools Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.support.stp/versions], the following error is thrown in {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{noformat}2016-01-06 17:41:20,513 WARN [support-request] [support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask] zip Error processing 'Healthchecks Results': NullPointerException: Specified service reference cannot be null.
 -- referer: https://wiki.vsct.fr/plugins/servlet/stp/view/ | url: /plugins/servlet/stp/view/support-zip/execute | userName: robert_mota
java.lang.NullPointerException: Specified service reference cannot be null.
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl.ungetService(BundleContextImpl.java:338)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.salext.bundle.HealthcheckResultsBundle.getHealthcheckResults(HealthcheckResultsBundle.java:80)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.salext.bundle.HealthcheckResultsBundle.getFiles(HealthcheckResultsBundle.java:39)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.zip(CreateSupportZipTask.java:202)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.createSupportZip(CreateSupportZipTask.java:73)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask$1.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask$1.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:26)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745){noformat}

Despite the error, the support.zip will be generated.

h4. Workaround
No action needed, however:
- Version 3.7.5 does not reproduce the issue, thus downgrading may be an option until a fix is available.
- Unchecking {{Health Check Results}} tickbox avoids the error.

h4. Possible cause
bq. Included Healthchecks results in Support Zip for Confluence and JIRA.
- In release [3.7.11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.support.stp/versions]
fields.summary: "Error processing 'Healthchecks Results': NullPointerException: Specified service reference cannot be null." when generating support.zip

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence, there exists a quick search functionality where you can start typing in the search box and it will automatically find suggestions for you without ever having to hit *enter*.

h3. Suggested Solution
This does not exist in JIRA and would be nice to have implemented

h3. Workaround
There are a few add-ons for Server:
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.communardo.jira.quicksearch/server/overview
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icfilters.jira-icfilters/server/overview

Unfortunately, this does not exist for Cloud users.
fields.summary: Provide a JIRA automatic search functionality similar to that of Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59269].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When you delete or merge a version that has many issues assigned (for instance 200). The operation times out and an error message is shown.
However, the version is still being removed in an 'abandoned' request thread and finally disappears from the versions list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create at least 200 issues and set their fix version/s to A.
2. Delete version A from project administration.
3.*BUG* The operation will timeout in the UI, although the version will proceed and be successful in the background.

h3. Actual Results

The Delete/Merge Version operations time out when the number of issues involved is large.

h3. Expected Results

The UI operation does not time out regardless of the number of issues involved in the deletion or merging of versions.

 h3. Notes

This affects both version delete / merge. Cloud is more affected than server by this because the request time-out in the Cloud environment is shorter.
fields.summary: Deleting a version that has many issues assigned to it leads to a time out
HAProxy load balancer example cookie problems

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
On a Dashboard gadget with a quick filter search "Saved Filter" entering a special character such as: + - ( ' ; " etc displays an error popup.
!char_breaks_search.jpeg!

It reads: "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."


h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1
* Dashboard gadgets
* Confluence macros of JIRA with filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget to a dashboard (or any other gadget with filters)
# Type a special character

h3. Expected Results
Results window mentions that there are no results matching the search.

h3. Actual Results
* Popup with error appears on screen.

Entering a * or ? triggers a 400 (Bad Request) error instead of 500 (Internal Server Error). This is probably due to previous work to capture the error: [JRA-18317|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18317]
 
h3. Notes
* Working previously on JIRA v6.4 where * and ? cause 400 errors in the browser console but don't generate popup
* Errors while configuring Confluence macros won't trigger a popup but will generate a JIRA error.
* This is also reproducible for filters with names such as {{TeamA - new}}. The moment the user types {{TeamA -}}  on the saved filter field, then the above UI error pops up and the filter  {{TeamA - new}} is no longer suggested. 

h3.Workaround
* Select the option to "Prevent this page from creating additional dialogs"
fields.summary: Filter Search in gadgets returns 500 error with special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59263].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The quick search "Saved Filter" inside Gadgets is not listing all available filters that match the search criteria. It returns a list of 10 items that match the search criteria and then does consecutive searches over those first 10 items, missing filters that were not included in the first results.

h3. Affects
* JIRA 7.1
* Dashboard Gadgets
* Confluence Macros with JIRA filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 11 or more Filters that start with the same word. e.g: "Filter A","Filter B", etc
# Add the "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget to a Dashboard
# Search for the 11th filter by typing "Filter K"

h3. Expected Results
The Filter is found because the search matches the filter's name.

h3. Actual Results
* Typing the first name returns 10 filters. Good so far.
* Typing the start of the second word brings no results or a sub group of the previous 10 results.
 
h3. Notes
* Doesn't affect JIRA 6.4 and previous.
* Searching for "K" in the example, will find the 11th filter but if the site has another 10 filters with the letter K, it may not. Making it unsearchable.

h3.Workarounds
* Use the Advanced Search to find the filter (not available in Confluence macros)
* Add a unique word to the filter.
* Search for the second word. This will only work if the 10 results for the second word include the filter.
fields.summary: Filter Search in gadgets doesn't find all filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59262].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever you select a project from the "Projects" menu, it brings up what looks like the details view (with the issues list on the left, and the currently-selected issue on the right). You then need to click "view all issues and filters" to get back to the List View.

h3. Suggested Solution
I’d like to have the list view to be the default each time I select a project (to avoid the need to click "view all issues and filters" every time I change projects) from the “Projects” dropdown.

Note: this same question was posted here (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15701634/how-can-i-set-the-issue-screen-to-show-the-list-and-not-detail-view-by-default), but there isn't yet an answer.
fields.summary: Default Issue view from the "Projects" menu
